Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Fungal Families of the World. CAB International, Cambridge (ISBN: 978-0851998275)

Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. 2265 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;NA;NA Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Fungal Families of the World. CAB International, Cambridge (ISBN: 978-0851998275)

2396 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;NA;NA Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Fungal Families of the World. CAB International, Cambridge (ISBN: 978-0851998275)

Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. 3058 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;g__Brachyphoris;s__oviparasitica Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Fungal Families of the World. CAB International, Cambridge (ISBN: 978-0851998275)

Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. 3243 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;NA;NA Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Fungal Families of the World. CAB International, Cambridge (ISBN: 978-0851998275)

3794 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;NA;NA Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Fungal Families of the World. CAB International, Cambridge (ISBN: 978-0851998275)

3948 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;g__Orbilia;NA Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. 4873 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;NA;NA Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. 5277 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;g__Orbilia;NA Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Fungal Families of the World. CAB International, Cambridge (ISBN: 978-0851998275)

Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. 5757 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;NA;NA Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Fungal Families of the World. CAB International, Cambridge (ISBN: 978-0851998275)

5928 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;g__Orbilia;NA Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. 6403 k__Fungi;p__Ascomycota;c__Orbiliomycetes;o__Orbiliales;f__Orbiliaceae;g__Orbilia;NA Orbiliaceae 1CB19716-36B9-11D5-9548-00D0592D548C 81091 9 Saprotroph Wood Saprotroph Probable Microfungus NULL Saprobic, found especially on wood in both wet and dry habitats. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007. Many species are nematophagous, forming adhesive knobs, nets or ring-like traps in the presence of a food source; perhaps a strategy for life in low-nitrogen environments. There have been reports of associations with algae for a few species, but an established lichen association appears not to exist (Cannon & Kirk 2007) Cannon PF, Kirk PM. 2007.
